intro: Ypsilopus iversenii, commonly known as the Iversen's ypsilopus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust root systems. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
